info.title: Barclays Bank Ireland Account Information
info.description: Creates a new consent at the ASPSP to indicate that the customer intends to retrieve accounts and their details through the Third Party Provider (TPP)

get.description: Retrieves a list of bank accounts, with balances where required. It is assumed that a consent of the PSU to this access is already given and stored on the ASPSP system.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Accept header

parameters.name: bookingStatus
parameters.description: Filters the transactions by booking status

schema.description: Filters the transactions by booking status

parameters.name: dateFrom
parameters.description: Starting date (inclusive the date dateFrom) of the transaction list, mandated if no delta access is required.For booked transactions, the relevant date is the booking date.For pending transactions, the relevant date is the entry date, which may not be transparent neither in this API nor other channels of the ASPSP.

schema.description: Starting date (inclusive the date dateFrom) of the transaction list, mandated if no delta access is required.For booked transactions, the relevant date is the booking date.For pending transactions, the relevant date is the entry date, which may not be transparent neither in this API nor other channels of the ASPSP.

parameters.name: dateTo
parameters.description: End date (inclusive the data dateTo) of the transaction list, default is "now" if not given.For booked transactions, the relevant date is the booking date.For pending transactions, the relevant date is the entry date, which may not be transparent neither in this API nor other channels of the ASPSP

schema.description: End date (inclusive the data dateTo) of the transaction list, default is "now" if not given.For booked transactions, the relevant date is the booking date.For pending transactions, the relevant date is the entry date, which may not be transparent neither in this API nor other channels of the ASPSP

parameters.name: Digest
parameters.description: Is contained only if the "Signature" element is contained in the header of the request

schema.description: Is contained only if the "Signature" element is contained in the header of the request

parameters.name: Signature
parameters.description: A signature of the request by the TPP on application level.

schema.description: A signature of the request by the TPP on application level.

parameters.name: TPP-Redirect-Preferred
parameters.description:
If it equals true, the TPP prefers a Redirect over Decoupled SCA approach. If it equals false, Decoupled SCA Approach will be applied
IMPORTANT - Currently, Implicit Redirect SCA Approach is supported, so TPP-Redirect-Preferred must equal true.

schema.description:
If it equals true, the TPP prefers a Redirect over Decoupled SCA approach. If it equals false, Decoupled SCA Approach will be applied
IMPORTANT - Currently, Implicit Redirect SCA Approach is supported, so TPP-Redirect-Preferred must equal true.

parameters.name: TPP-Redirect-URI
parameters.description: URI of the TPP, where the transaction flow shall be redirected to after a Redirect. It is mandatory for the Redirect SCA Approach (including OAuth2 SCA approach).

schema.description: URI of the TPP, where the transaction flow shall be redirected to after a Redirect. It is mandatory for the Redirect SCA Approach (including OAuth2 SCA approach).

parameters.name: TPP-Nok-Redirect-URI
parameters.description: If this URI is contained, the TPP is asking to redirect the transaction flow to this address instead of the TPP-Redirect-URI in case of a negative result of the redirect SCA method

schema.description: If this URI is contained, the TPP is asking to redirect the transaction flow to this address instead of the TPP-Redirect-URI in case of a negative result of the redirect SCA method

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Content Type header

schema.description: Content Type header

get.description: Returns the content of an account information consent object. This is returning the data for the TPP especially in cases, where the consent was directly managed between ASPSP and PSU e.g. in a re-direct SCA Approach
